intro: Canacorchis lophoglottis, commonly known as the red-flowered orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety red petals and a distinctive yellow lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
